summary.headline: Playoff Showdown: Mariners @ Blue Jays
summary.description: A true toss-up playoff game with the Blue Jays getting the slightest edge at home.

games.analysis: TOSS-UP GAME: This is essentially a coin flip - the closest possible prediction. Minimal statistical difference between the teams. Classic playoff unpredictability scenario.
games.home_field_factor: Toronto gets the slightest edge due to home field advantage. Familiar conditions and home crowd support. Only reason the model leans toward Toronto (50.5% vs 49.5%).
why_low_confidence: Minimal statistical difference between teams (only 0.5% edge)
Small factors could easily swing the outcome either way
Playoff pressure makes historical data less predictive
Pitching matchups and day-of factors will be crucial
key_insights: Nearly Even Matchup: This is as close as predictions get in baseball
Home Field Minimal: Only tiny advantage for Toronto
High Variance: Actual game could go either way easily
Betting Perspective: Very slight lean toward Toronto, but essentially even money
Playoff Context: Single-elimination pressure makes this highly unpredictable
